Reviews.Title: WIFI IP Camera
Reviews.Author: cadblu
Reviews.Content: Having experience in IP Cams, this camera did not disappoint.  Setup was a breeze using the supplied mini CD.  Once the network finds the camera, the wireless feature is activated using the wifi setup screen, and setting up port forwarding on the network router. The camera is used indoors to keep an eye on pets.  Pan and tilt with audio works great.  I use with both google chrome and Internet Explorer.  Video quality on par with Foscam equivalents.  For a fraction of the price of the Foscams, I highly recommend this Tenvis model.

Reviews.Title: Works very well, but some shortcomings and caveats.
Reviews.Author: Rich P
Reviews.Content: It comes with IP camera Wizard software on a CD, which was very easy to use.  Even those who don't know networking should be able to get the camera working on their home network.But here's the first caveat.  The initial set up DOES require a hard wired ethernet connection to do.  If you don't have that you have a problem.Next caveat - after you get it talking to your network immediately do the software and firmware upgrades (if available for your model).  It's make for a much better experience.The night vision works VERY well for a dark room.  The web page that pulls up when you access the camera is easy to use.  With 10 seconds of instruction my wife was accessing the camera, moving it around, etc.And the image is impressively clear.Now for some shortcomings.  First - the power cord is only 3-4 feet long.  The short cord limits where you can place or mount the camera.  Ideally the camera should be up a little higher than eye level.  But unless your are going to install a custom electric outlet that's tough to do. Of course you do have an option to splice the power cord or use and extension cord - not real good options aesthetically for going up a wall..Shortcoming #2 - I had wanted to put it in a window looking out for security.  Works fine during the day.  But the lens is encircled with LED's that it uses for night vision.  When placed to look out the window these LED's reflect off the glass and make seeing anything outside impossible.  And since it is not weather proof just leaving it outside is not an option.  I don't know if it would have the same problem of reflection in a weatherproof enclosure.  And putting it outside one would have to deal with issues of power and the short power cord.Next caveat.  I can access it from my Android smart phone.  I tried it both using a browser and also an app.  Yeah, it works.  But the features of motion are erratic at best and leave a lot to be desired. +*+*EDITED March 6, 2013 - the new app for Android and the new web page for viewing have corrected this problem

Reviews.Title: Baby Monitor
Reviews.Author: Marcos Garcia "Veremos"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product with the purpose of monitor my baby in his new room. The camera has a great price and features. The quality of image is very good. These are the cons for this camera for the purpose I'm using it:The camera reset itself frequently with the on line tool and loses the point you were looking at and the audio.If I go to sleep and the the camera resets itself, I lose the baby view and the audio because every time you start the camera, the audio needs to be turned on.I found an alternative solution to stream with VLC and it does not reset as much (once every two weeks) and the audio is on all the time which is vital for my inetented purpose because when you are sleeping, what is warning you if something is wrong is the audio. But still the audio has delay and after a few hours becomes intermittent.I have the camera in a wireless mode. I will try to connect it with LAN to see if it will improve.***Update***Using VLC and a LAN instead of wireless, the camera does not reset the position and the delay of the audio is only 2 or 3 seconds but I can live with it. Much better performance and serve the purpose. I have not checked for upgrades in the softwares or in the online tool.

Reviews.Title: Seriously...you get what you pay for.
Reviews.Author: R. Vernon "FrankenPC"
Reviews.Content: OK.  So, it's probably obvious at this point that the camera's are all clones.  If you've scanned Amazon for IP camera, you've probably seen a dozen of these same cameras under different names.  So, this review applies to all of them.  I'm not singling out {insert Chinese clone hardware retailer here}.Firstly, the IR filters have  been removed to give the sensors night vision capabilities.  This causes weird color shifting.  The sensors being used are very low resolution and low grade.  Also, the on board micro-controller dishing out the Wi-Fi, video/audio compression, motion control, etc is very under powered for all its tasks.  In other words, all corners have been cut.  That's to be  expected for this price point.Second, SINCE these all are the same hardware, the differentiation is the software support.  Again, not much difference.  I will say that the main difference APPEARS to be one of two things:  audio support and mobile device application support.  For instance, I downloaded the Android Foscam IP video viewer and  it worked with the Tenvis clone. Tenvis claims to have two way audio support.  This is a misnomer.  It REALLY only works with a highly specialized IE plugin.  Running  Win 7 x64 with IE 9 and 10, I have yet to get it to work.  So, forget audio.Finally:  performance for the actual task.  OK, if you are INSIDE your home network using a browser like Chrome on a fast PC, the video and pan/tilt support is very responsive.  Deceptively so.  It's only when you go outside the firewall do you see how incredibly laggy the camera is.  It's almost unbearable.  I think I'll  ultimately install GotoMyPC on my Android tablet and remote in to view the video on Chrome ON my internal PC.  A lot of work to get decent video.  That's what you get when you go cheap.Pros:  CHEAP to the point of being nearly disposable.  Who cares if it breaks.  For an internal security station, these would be ideal.  Easy to make the initial connection and configure (as long as you completely ignore the install instructions and realize the IP address is printed on the bottom of the camera).  Pan and tilt are smooth.  Works at night.  Small and light.Cons:  Capabilities are misleading if not outright lies.  My overall impression of the support software is that it's in early beta.  MAY want to pay additional bucks for a camera that uses more sophisticated software/firmware especially in the video compression arena.

Reviews.Title: Would be great if it worked...
Reviews.Author: Erin R. Deatrick
Reviews.Content: ORIGINAL REVIEW 1/7/14:I bought this camera to be able to view the footage from my android phone.  I was able to set it up for viewing on my computer on my home network easily so I thought this was going to be a breeze to set up.  Well, I was dead wrong.  To set up the remote view (to view from an outside computer) you have to set up a static Ip address and do some port forwarding.  I can read directions, so I went to the forums to figure out how to do that.  Hours and days later, I was able to get it to work most of the time .  But the remote viewing on my Android still wasn't working.  But it was weird, because it would work sometimes (about 5%) and the rest of the time it said "Camera Feed Not Available."Then the remote viewing from a computer completely stopped working. So I emailed customer service, and he was very timely in his responses.  But remember they are in Beijing so that adds another layer of difficulty.  He did some remote assistance and was able to get my remote viewing from another computer to work (he changed the port number).  However, he checked the settings on my android and said they were right. But it still didn't work but he had no further suggestions.  I downloaded multiple viewing apps thinking maybe that was the problem, but none of them work.  But remember, it worked a couple times on my phone, so I know the settings are correct. I've tried it on 3 different phones, both android and iphone.  It just simply does not work 95% + of the time.  Also, the night vision has not been working either.  So basically, this thing is worthless to me.  And I have wasted SO MUCH time trying to get it to work I am completely frustrated and decided to call it a loss and find something better.If you are just looking for a camera just to view from inside your home network, this may be ok for you because that part was easy to set up.  And as long as the night vision doesn't go out like it did on mine, you may be ok.  But if you want remote mobile viewing I would stay far, far away from this one!UPDATE 1/27/14:My rating has changed from a 1 star to a 3 star. I increased my rating because I was finally able to get it to work correctly after hours and hours of trial and error and help from a third party product. I can only give the actual product a 3 star because the built-in DDNS didn't work. The process of setting it up and the support gets 0 stars.  I was determined to get this thing to work with my mobile view (I had so much time invested, it was getting personal, lol).  I knew that since it worked about 5% of the time, that the camera was capable.  I had a feeling the entire time that it was a problem with the DDNS (the website you use to log on from a remote device). I asked the support person if this could be the case, but they kept telling me no, that everything was fine since they were able to connect to the DDNS from China. Well, they may be able to connect from China, but I couldn't here in the US.  So I decided to do some research on DDNS (I'm not a technical expert and have never dealt with this before).  I found some instructions on the foscam website (they make a very similar camera) on how to set up an external DDNS instead of using the one built into the camera.  I used No-ip, and low and behold, it worked!!! Now I can view from my android and it works 100% of the time. I was so excited (literally hooting and hollering in my living room) that after months and months I finally got it to work.  So if anyone is having the same problem as I am, try no-ip.com and click on DNS. You'll then have to go into your camera settings and uncheck the built-in DDNS and fill in the info for the third-party DDNS. It wasn't too complicated to set up.  You'll be glad you did!  Or better yet, just return it and get another one, hopefully you'll get lucky the second time and get one with a properly functioning built-in DDNS.  But the bottom line is, the built-in DDNS is faulty on some of the cameras and doesn't allow you to connect remotely, and the support team should have known that.  I'm so mad that I spent so many hours on this and it was a somewhat easy fix.  Hopefully this will save someone out there about 40 hours of pain.

Reviews.Title: Perfect in our nursery
Reviews.Author: Heather T.
Reviews.Content: We actually use this camera in our baby's nursery! I love that both we can use both our phones, ipad and computers to see the image from this camera. I also like that it can sit on a shelf or be mounted to a wall and be stable either way.

Reviews.Title: My first ever 1 star review
Reviews.Author: Deshen
Reviews.Content: This product may deserve 2 stars, it works under wired LAN connection with tolerable picture quality and you can remote control the camera from your PC, which is pretty cool,  but this camera can never connect to my router wirelessly as long as I set a password for my wifi network, no matter it's WEP/WPA/WPA2, I checked the technical support forum on their website, no solution found, what make me have to give it 1 star is a card in its box, which says if you leave them a 5-star product review, they will send you a $15 rebate check, I think that well explains why this low quality camera has so many 5-stars reviews which obviously overate it!

Reviews.Title: It didn't work for me
Reviews.Author: Kenneth Quinty "kquinty"
Reviews.Content: I wasted 8 hours of my life trying to configure this camera for wireless transmission without success.  I followed the instructions and got it to work with the cable connected, but the LAN connection never worked.

Reviews.Title: Value for the Money
Reviews.Author: Philip Blew
Reviews.Content: This internet ready camera does all that it's supposed to.  Instructions in the box are a little thin, but youtube videos and online manuals make up for it.

Reviews.Title: Solid Pan/Tilt wireless IP camera at a good value.
Reviews.Author: Josh H.

Reviews.Title: Great camera once it gets going
Reviews.Author: K. T. Chiang
Reviews.Content: I almost returned this camera after following the installation instructions a few times.  I was not able to view the camera remotely from the internet.  It turns out that when using the Tenvis Sight app on my android phone, the host address needs to be something like "us16196.mytenvis.org" as shown in the camera's DDNS setting, instead of the camera's internal network IP address that I incorrectly entered - I must have wasted an entire hour figuring out why I could not connect to the camera from my phone.  Also, be sure that you follow the instructions in the PDF file for port forwarding on your router.  Camera works well, even in total darkness, and has a two-way audio to let you carry limited conversation!!  I give it a four star since the installation instruction still requires improvement in clarifying the correct host address to use when trying to access the camera remotely from the internet.

Reviews.Title: Working perfectly
Reviews.Author: Daev
Reviews.Content: Set up and integrated into my system easily and quickly.  I've had two of them operating indoors for almost five months now.  The only time there was a problem with one (the picture froze) I just reset it remotely and it's been fine ever since.If you want a simple WiFi pan-tilt night vision camera it would be hard to find a better value.

Reviews.Title: Worked well
Reviews.Author: John Daniels "Engineer"
Reviews.Content: The camera set up very easily on my home wireless network. The instructions were clear enough and I was able to set it up on the first attempt. Have not set up the mobile phone access yet but am very pleased with the bring up at this time.

Reviews.Title: Great little webcam!
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: This is a terrific little indoor IP webcam for the money. Installation was easy--you just connect it to your router first with a CAT5 cable, and the software will guide you through the process of establishing a wired connection, then a wireless connection, and finally an Internet connection (using port forwarding from the Tenvis web site). That last feat means you can access your video from any Internet device: laptops, iPads, smartphones, etc. Cool! This is much more than one of those little USB webcams. It's actually a little wi-fi webserver that you can remotely control!To achieve the night vision, these cameras must be sensitive to the infrared wavelengths (by removing the IR filter). That introduces many surprises. For example, some daylight colors appear a little goofy (e.g., blue-gray trees). And while you can see people and objects near the camera that are within reach of the LED lighting at night, realize that in infrared, everything will essentially be black and white, with warm, reflective things appearing bright, and cool, absorptive things appearing dark. It's tempting to place the camera near a window (great during the day!), but don't expect to see through the glass at night--all you'll see is the reflection of the bright infrared LEDs.The pan tilt feature really works well. Pan is almost a full 360. However, the tilt (up/down) motion is mostly "Up."  If your main interest is looking down (to see your pets or little children, for example), your best bet is to mount the camera inverted (using included brackets) and choose the "vertical flip" option in the camera setup.Note that you can turn off the blinking green LED using the web page configuration, making it pretty stealthy. Few people will notice it sitting on the bookshelf, doing its thing! Speaking of web page, did I say it was a mini-web server? There must be at least a hundred configuration settings and parameters under your control, via its "settings" web pages. Very geeky, if you're into that sort of thing.The wi-fi feature allows you to locate the camera anywhere within range of your home wi-fi router. All you need is an electric outlet to plug in the power supply. Hint: replacing the provided antenna (SMA connector--nice!) with a high-gain wifi antenna will greatly extend how far away from the router you can place the camera.It's too bad this camera is not rated for outdoors. But it's compact pan-tilt motion makes it feasible to place inside a clear plastic (weatherproof) dome. I'll have to search for one of those...

Reviews.Title: Amazing price for an IP camera!
Reviews.Author: Brett M
Reviews.Content: This is my second Tenvis IP camera purchase. I got the white to blend in more with the room I installed it in. It was a breeze to set up using the included CD and instructions. The two way audio is a great bonus to this camera. It runs very smooth and has a nice connection to my router. I would have paid much more for this and have in the past. I did communicate with Tenvis technical support via their website and the response was very quick and the rep seemed very knowledgeable. These cameras make for a great security system for when you are away. I use my WP8 cell phone to view the house and the speed is fine. I usually try to have my phone on WIFI to keep things up to speed. All in all, I would reccomend this camera!

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: John Poole
Reviews.Content: Got it for checking on my Mom.Works good at house, but not on another wifi.Sounds cost you.Customer service is in china through email only.

Reviews.Title: budget camera
Reviews.Author: Dustan Dennington
Reviews.Content: Find budget cameramotion seems rather blurred with movementpicture is nice with good lightingPTZ isn't very responsive.Web interface is very goodEasy wifi setup with Ethernet cableCan turn LED on or off or blinking rather customize able for a budget camera.Bottom line if you aren't willing to spend the $150 for a nice 720p or 1080p camera get this cheap one is on par with other non high quality cameras.

Reviews.Title: Image freezes on browser randomly
Reviews.Author: Dr. Jeffrey Harris "Dr. Jeffrey Harris"
Reviews.Content: I read the bad reviews on this camera but since they were half the price of the Foscam I thought I would give them a try and return them if they didn't work out.  Well it didn't take me more than 30 minutes to cancel the order and return them.  The image on the browser would freeze and the camera was unresponsive.  Rebooting the camera did not help.  I had to flush the browser cache and start again.  The problem is that I am putting these cameras into a surveillance scenario and triggering a recording upon motion detected.  If the image freezes there will never be motion detected and the software has no way of knowing that the camera is hosed up.  Too bad, because it had all of the features that I wanted.  I always end up going back to Foscam.  They charge more but its worth it.  By the way, I have no connection to any camera company.  I'm just a consumer who wants the product I buy to work according to its published spec.

Reviews.Title: Great Peace of Mind
Reviews.Author: F. Oquendo "Papo"
Reviews.Content: I purchased one of these TENVIS Wireless IP Pan/Tilt/ Night Vision Internet Surveillance Camera Built-in Microphone With Phone remote monitoring support(White) to monitor the inside of our home while my wife and I were away. We were away for almost three weeks and being able to view the inside of our house brought us great peace of mind.I selected this camera for two main reasons: its low price, especially considering its great features and because of the features themselves. The pan and tilt features allow us to view all entrances to our home to make sure everything was secured. We have three doors leading to our living room and we could easily rotate the camera remotely to view all three doors and make sure they were as we left them.We also have a 105 gallon fish tank, and although it is out of the camera view, we could use the built-in microphone to listen to the operation of the water filtration system. The built-in microphone also allowed us to monitor the house for unusual noises, like from a would be robber.I am not going into specifics about its setup as this has been covered by other reviewers. However, I would like to provide some suggestions that may help you take full advantage of the camera's features.1. Change the default login name and password to prevent others to gain access to your camera over the internet...you don't want strangers looking inside your home. 2. Choose the best position for your camera that can take full advantages of all its features...try different areas of your home. 3. Unplug your camera when you are at home...you don't want someone to hack into your camera and watch your every move.Finally, don't rely solely on this camera or one system for security purposes; get a burglar alarm system and/or an outdoor camera security system. You'll love the great peace of mine.

Reviews.Title: seems simple
Reviews.Author: zach
Reviews.Content: this seemed simple enough to set up and run but iv never had as many problems setting up this cam to go wireless .. everything seems to be going wrong! as soon as I figure one problem out it seems another one pops up, I don't know if its just me and my computer but if this thing doesn't start working soon I think I'm going to snap!!!

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: John Heikkila
Reviews.Content: When I first got the camera, the image looked great, pan worked great, but the tilt did not. Called technical support and what a joke; it is an answering machine (no matter how many times at any time of the day) with a hard to understand woman telling you to just email technical support. I have emailed technical support, numerous times over a couple of times, no response. I am going to try there forums next, but if they are anything like there phone and email service, I will not receive the help that I am needing. I will update when I finally make contact with them, if I do not in the next day I will be returning and going with a different brand. As of right now, I cannot say that I will consider them again. BUY WITH CAUTION!!!!

Reviews.Title: Sorry... freezes all the time.  Waste of money
Reviews.Author: Capt Dan "Capt Dan"
Reviews.Content: I can connect to the camera using IE10 under windows 7, and the camera will work until you try to move it.  Then if freezes and you can't do anything with the camera.Not ready for prime time.

Reviews.Title: Won't honor warranty
Reviews.Author: Jerkules
Reviews.Content: After very light use over a 5 month period it just stopped working.  Despite the "2 year warranty" Tenvis told me I had to return it to the seller, which happened to be an Amazon seller.  Amazon tried to make me feel like they were doing me a favor by taking the return outside the return window, even though this was a defective product.  Then I find out that I was charged a restocking fee.  Camera was fine when it worked but don't expect any warranty service whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: hard to set up with my system
Reviews.Author: Lee White
Reviews.Content: when I first received the device I set it up with the cat 5 wire installed I could not get the wi-fi function to work and let it set for a few days and then in preparation for a trip out of town and could not get it to work in any method.  So I do not know if it is broken or if it is just me.  meanwhile it just sits out on the patio with a blinking light so maybe that will scare off any intruders other than that it is worthless to me.  Due to my out of town travels it is now to late toreturn it so I will just leave it where it sets.

Reviews.Title: good product
Reviews.Author: Essam Kamal
Reviews.Content: it is a good product that you can buy with confidence,  the setup is easy and I tested it from samsung galaxy s2 and worked beautifully

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the money
Reviews.Author: HRS
Reviews.Content: Takes a little work and research to set up. But works good for the money. Used Utube for help on port forwarding.Not for windows 7 and ie9 but ok with chrome.

Reviews.Title: Camera set up quickly!
Reviews.Author: Reid
Reviews.Content: This camera works absolutely flawless! I tested it at night and it is able to record really well. It connected to my wireless router easily and it stated streaming just like that.

Reviews.Title: Working Great!
Reviews.Author: A. Hanna
Reviews.Content: After looking through several different wifi IP cameras I found these and bought two.  I've set them up to use as nanny cams and the picture quality is fantastic.  It has a built in web interface that is really smooth. It comes with a CD but I am not sure what it is for because you can do everything by just typing in the web address (I just googled the default IP address) and made my setting changes from there.  I would have to say it would be of benefit if there was a small sheet that had the basic instructions with it.  Like default username/password and IP address, and instructions for the CD use and without.The customer service has been great and send out a very welcoming message after you buy the cameras.  They are a dramatic upgrade after looking at our little phillips baby monitor all the time.  The movement is very responsive and access is a breeze.  Thanks for the great product!

Reviews.Title: Bad Picture quality, avail customer support with work
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: This camera is okay; the picture quality is not good and hard to pan correctly. The feed goes down a lot online so don't expect to monitor all the time. I had difficulty getting in touch with Tenvis as their hours are 7:30am to 3:30pm monday to friday. I work so that's not easy hours. I did contact the company I purchased from and left a message and they called me back. Then the tech support for tenvis called an hour later. They skyped and he did help me get the feed online. But the next morning, feed has gone down again. The price is cheap on this camera, so if cost is an issue and you need a quick monitoring camera, go for it. I am just looking for something a little better. The camera will get about a 380P viewing which is around 640x480 pixels.

Reviews.Title: Does everything it says it does ...
Reviews.Author: Klopchik
Reviews.Content: I'm new to the world of IP cams so I can not compare, but this little cam does everything it says it does: wireless, night vision, and can be monitored and moved via web or iPhone app. It is exactly what i was looking for! It may not be top-of-the-line quality but as other reviews say its good for the $.Watch out for:1. the set up is a bit confusing and we had to look up and manually enter the correct IP address into the set up wizard2. the limit of the password is 8 characters, enter more and it does not work! (solution found on the Tenvis website forum)3. does not zoom (which it does not claim to do, but would be nice)

Reviews.Title: Works great, easy to set-up
Reviews.Author: Eric McAllister
Reviews.Content: Works great, easy to set-up, I will be using this as a baby monitor and it appears to fit the bill.  I won't know for sure for a couple months though.

Reviews.Title: works as described...Now I can keep an eye on my dogs
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Williams "Lance"
Reviews.Content: i use this product to allow my wife to check in on the dogs while we travel...She is happy and I dont have to hear about it anymore

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Gene Maletta
Reviews.Content: I love this camera it because it pans and tilts smoothly, the color is very clear. You can hear everything that's going on and you can preset the camera to different positions. The set up was easy and had it up and running in a few minutes. I would recommend this camera to anyone. Also the Android app is cool that this company puts out.

Reviews.Title: Great Product, however you must be knowledgable.
Reviews.Author: Jay
Reviews.Content: Great product, but you have to be advanced computer savvy. Knowing the very basics in this case will not cut it.My biggest concern was having the ability to view from my iPhone and work. After 20hrs between research and troubleshooting.I was able to overcome the challenge. Do I consider myself computer savvy sure.Advanced yes, but not an expert. For me it's the challenge and learning new things.This review is about you, not me. The product is great, WIFI works great in the house, but the concern presents itself when you want to view outside of your home.If you can get that figured out. I applaud you.

Reviews.Title: Works as advertised!  Easy setup!
Reviews.Author: Jason K.
Reviews.Content: This product works as advertised.  It is easy to setup using the software provided by Tenvis.  Can easily control the camera via the suggested app or from the provided URL.  Fast shipping and product as described.  Thanks!!

Reviews.Title: Fun for a Hobby - Not realistic for SECURITY
Reviews.Author: Dach
Reviews.Content: After having this camera for several weeks, I've decided to leave a review.It was easy to set up for internal use.  If you can set up a wifi router beyond the defaults, you can do this.  Port forwarding was straight forward for me but someone more of an advance network capability for some.My thoughts on the unit itself.  It will not withstand a drop from a counter.  The plastic is cheap.  But that's what I would expect for an item in this price range.  It met my expectations.How does it look?  The iphone app is basic and shows what I want it to.  The web browser view is much better and offers many more options and user customizations.  One piece that messed me up for a few ways was that you need to create stored positions and then in the pan/tilt menu, set one of those as the default.Here's where it let me down.  The ALARM component is a piece of junk.  Like many reviewers on the Tenvis forums, the sensitivity settings are worthless.  I have it on the lowest sensitivity setting and each time the sun goes behind the clouds and changes my property from light to dark (generally), it sends me emails with attachments for several minutes.  However, when the Brown truck guy pulls in my driveway and into the cameras view, it totally misses that.So in conclusion, if you're looking for a camera to have fun with and to just check on the view of things at home from work or via the iPhone app, it's great.  If you have a realistic expectation for it to email you when and only when it senses movement or objects in view such as a burglar, you need to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: Tenvis Wireless Camera
Reviews.Author: Lindsay S. Dober
Reviews.Content: This purchase was intended to be used as a baby monitor while out of the home.  It was easy to set up and easy to use. Planning on getting another one!

Reviews.Title: Very good Wireless IP CAM for good price!!
Reviews.Author: DC
Reviews.Content: I had purchased this TENVIS IP CAM about half year ago and I am very satisfied with all the functions it can provide so I purchased the second one few days ago. Installation is very easy and with TENVIS's DNS service I can access both IP CAMs' video remotely while I am away from home through my phone. I also enable the motion detection email alert so I can receive instant photo sanp shot to my email account whenever there is motion detected.I will definitely recommend this product to my friends.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Matias
Reviews.Content: It is really cool, it works so well. I have enjoyed this camera so much. I recommend buying it because it is wireless and it is a very nice product.

Reviews.Title: Would recommend!
Reviews.Author: Brittney
Reviews.Content: We researched and Reviewed many cameras...this is the best bang for your buck! Easy to set up and has great features!

Reviews.Title: Perfect camera for my setup...
Reviews.Author: Victor Alvarez
Reviews.Content: This camera exceed my expectations. It beats other expensive cameras. I'm using it for monitoring my pets and I was amazed with the image quality. The setup was very easy that anyone with little knowledge on tech can setup them. Maybe a large antenna can let me install it father away where it is installed now. Also a larger power cord is needed, for a camera that's usually installed above 6 feet . Really recommend it for anyone , I'm very satisfied with the quality and easy use.

Reviews.Title: Value is unbeatable!
Reviews.Author: Bigben
Reviews.Content: Just be careful to order the correct camera for your use. If you want good color you must order a camera with an IR cutout. Tenvis offers both types.

Reviews.Title: Very decent product
Reviews.Author: Samer Chalhoub
Reviews.Content: Everything is great about this. Price, functionality, looks and operation!Also need to mention that it's easy to use for standard non-geeky people.Recommend big time!

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Sandra C.
Reviews.Content: After a few days of setting the cameras up from my laptop and finally getting them to work, they work great!

Reviews.Title: I like this camera
Reviews.Author: Elena
Reviews.Content: Bought it to watch our pets, when we going out of state for a while. Very good quality! I can watch them all day or night. That's exactly what I expected.

Reviews.Title: WOW
Reviews.Author: Irais Passariello
Reviews.Content: I have . been extremely happy with this product. It was easy to install and to operate.  The vidio quality is outstanding. Sorry, I cannot say the same for the audio

Reviews.Title: good camera at great price
Reviews.Author: Hsin Yi Chen
Reviews.Content: Purchased the camera for my warehouse at work, easy installation, nice picture quality,,,good camera at great price..highly recommended for home security and small business..

Reviews.Title: Great IP Camera
Reviews.Author: Hunter
Reviews.Content: I have been looking on Amazon for several days to find a good camera to watch over our dog and house while we are away. It took a little bit of time to set up how I wanted it. I was happy with all the different features I could set it to do.  I was also easily able to set up the software and configure the camera to my wifi. When using my android phone the picture looks great and the camera responds well to the movement and picture commands via the app. This is a great purchase if you are just looking for a camera to keep on eye on things. No frills like zooming but I didn't need any of that I just wanted something cheap that would do the job and this came in with flying colors!

Reviews.Title: Mighty fine for the price
Reviews.Author: Be Squared
Reviews.Content: A few wrinkles in the Wi-Fi setup, but those were as much due to my inexperience as anything.  The picture is good day and night, and the unit functions as needed for surveillance at the front door where we have no peephole.  Now, if only I could figure out how to access the camera from the internet. . . .

Reviews.Title: Great IP Camera
Reviews.Author: eLoWeeZ
Reviews.Content: Great value for the price and works great. Highly recommended! Setup was a breeze and got it to work quickly. No issues encountered so far. If you are looking for a simple, easy to use IP camera with a great value, look no further.

Reviews.Title: LOVE THE QUALITY
Reviews.Author: Guy Minto
Reviews.Content: THESE CAMERAS WERE A BREEZE TO INSTALL, I LOVE THE PICTURE QUALITY AND THE MOBILTY OF THE CAMERAS, THE WIFI CAPABILITY MAKES THE INSTALL SIMPLE

Reviews.Title: Easy to setup, easy to use
Reviews.Author: J. Dempsey "jdempsey848"
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a camera to keep an eye on my dogs while I'm away from the house.  I was able to set up the camera in minutes and access the video image from both an iPhone 4 and a Samsung Galaxy III.  The picture is good.  Definitely pleased with product and recommend.

Reviews.Title: Cheap but works great
Reviews.Author: Chris Known
Reviews.Content: I bought it cheaper than the Foscam one.  I also have downloaded Tenvis Sight from google play store for free.  I can view both ip camera on that Tenvis Sight apps.  Tenvis one can send email alert to my email box whenever detect any motion.  I also have tested Audio function which works good.  Cheap but works great.

Reviews.Title: TENVIS
Reviews.Author: Tom Sutton
Reviews.Content: The camera is easy to run, so now I can monitor my home when I am gone from my iPhone.

Reviews.Title: Really easy to install
Reviews.Author: Luciana
Reviews.Content: I followed the instructions and it was very easy. I connected my PC and Samsung mobile without any problem, but the iPad i couldn't make it work. The app is different.The image of the camera is really good and also the night vision.

Reviews.Title: I will not recommend this brand
Reviews.Author: Fiel Resurreccion
Reviews.Content: Hard to configure. I checked the tutorial in YouTube and there is no dialogue to instruct you on how to configure it. I will not recommend this brand. The camera may be good but it has poor documentation.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding Camera Value
Reviews.Author: Mark Meyer
Reviews.Content: This camera was all it was advertised to be  plus.  Easy to install and set up.  Product website had all the app's.  Set up on my computer and Kindle perfectly.  Highly recommend.  Great value.

Reviews.Title: No Joke Great Deal and Easy Setup
Reviews.Author: daveno79
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical after reading other reviews stating this was a nightmare to install. I took a chance and bought two Tenvis wireless IP cams. This was such a breeze to install, if you know how to access your router via 192.168.something.something then this will be easy. I have no clue why others are having such a horrible time get this thing up. Took me 15 minutes to setup, with kids screaming all around me. The thing I was looking for was decent picture, accessible from outside my home and easy to setup; this covered all of that and more having it at a fair price. If your skeptical just buy it instructions are clear. If you don't know how to access your router just download a manual from the router manufacturers website. I'm so happy with this purchase!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Hack
Reviews.Content: The TENVIS JPT3815W is an excellent Wireless camera.  We just wanted a inexpensive camera to check on the little one and it does everything that we hoped and more.  I gave it a static IP and have not had a single problem interfacing with an Andriod and Laptop (IE).  The TENVIS Android app is awesome having the ability to program views, contrast, night vision, etc.  We tried downloading some third party apps for the Microsoft Surface but none matched the functinaly of the TENVIS Andriod app.  The only two issues we have are that the power cord is black (white camera) and audio is a little questionable.

Reviews.Title: Cameras work but do take some technical knowlege
Reviews.Author: nickw
Reviews.Content: Giving these a 5 star as they work as described.Some people have had issues with these failing and for the price you can expect it. These are not $200 drop cams. If you own a Netgear router the setup may need to be all manual. After going through everything manually and re-learning my system I would say manually setting all your ports and IP addresses is the way to go. There are some YouTube videos out there for the Tenvis camera setup. You should also check for how to do port forwarding through the manufacturer of your router.The last step is setting up the multi-cam from outside my network. Still can't figure it out. It is meant to work on LAN not external from the looks of it.One advancement I would make is better step by step instructions. There are a lot of things I would change to their instructions knowing what I know now.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Peter Shapiro
Reviews.Content: The camera is nice.  I recommend it for use to monitor or view things throughout your home  and elsewhere.  Peter

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: I purchased it for watching my dogs and to see who is at the front door. It was very easy to set up and I use it wirelessly. I haven't found out how to watch it away from home.

Reviews.Title: works good

Reviews.Content: Works well , nice and clear especially the night vision , only problem is the new firmware, now it pans the opposite way u want it to go and it wont store the presets, annoying

Reviews.Title: A Great Cam
Reviews.Author: ccalimbas "Cristina"
Reviews.Content: A little hard to set up at first, but great as a nanny cam! Serves its purpose, love the IR and alarm ability.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Gabe G.
Reviews.Content: this camera is made well and is easy to use. i like all the pan and tilt settings i will be getting more and would recommend them to anyone looking for wireless cameras

Reviews.Title: Best priced IP Camera

Reviews.Content: Great Product! easy to setup.. Love that i can view my home anywhere in the world.I bought other brands and these instructions and interface is the easiest to work with.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for....
Reviews.Author: sannas
Reviews.Content: It was very easy to set up and software was easy to install. No instructions necessary. The product worked great for two days and then it stopped working completely. I was very tempted to give this product a 5 star review just to get the $15 rebate but decided to return the product and purchase a better model instead

Reviews.Title: Baby Monitor Fail
Reviews.Author: Frank H. "booyah81"
Reviews.Content: This camera cannot double as a baby monitor because the audio is essentially non-existent. That said, even as a surveillance camera it may not be the best option due to these pros and cons:+ Affordable (much cheaper than the Foscam)+ Great features (e.g. pan/tilt/night vision)- Quality (first unit was DOA)- Ease of Installation (the instruction manual is terrible; I could only hook up normal in-network viewing, not via the internet)- Miniscule Audio (as noted above)If you're willing to put up with the lack of audio and the difficult installation, TENVIS is willing to pay you $15 for you to buy the camera and give it a 5-star review here on Amazon (no wonder this thing is so highly rated despite it being a terrible product).I ultimately bought an Infant Optics 2.4GHz baby monitor. No need to lose even more sleep than what the baby is already causing me.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I wanted.  And more.
Reviews.Author: Stephan E.
Reviews.Content: The device came properly packaged and required minimal set up to install to the proper systems I have at my disposal.  I'm glad to say that it functions 24/7 and I have had no problems thusfar.  Good craftsmanship, durability, and all-around badassery.  Thanks for giving me a decent product TENVIS.

Reviews.Title: secure beginnings
Reviews.Author: HUGH SIMCOE
Reviews.Content: Bought the Tenvis, not really knowing what to expect. I'm glad I did! Good product; easy to understand instructions. Will probably get another one. ..

Reviews.Title: Great camera for a great price
Reviews.Author: steve
Reviews.Content: Great product - works great on web browser (IE) and android phone. Watch the YouTube video if you need help installing the camera.

Reviews.Title: great product
Reviews.Author: Erik piermattei
Reviews.Content: Very easy to set up . Great to watch dog and kids when your running late. I did have one question called and they where very helpful and promt service. Cameras even came earlier that expected as well.

Reviews.Title: i love it.
Reviews.Author: Lisa Maria Silva Monroy
Reviews.Content: I love the features and it was very easy to install. It gives me a peace of mind keeping an eye on my child

Reviews.Title: Product works as expected!!
Reviews.Author: Kikomehito
Reviews.Content: set up was easy. took about 5 minutes. this camera is great for a watch camera . only thing is that it can not zoom.

Reviews.Title: Awesome for the price
Reviews.Author: Craig A
Reviews.Content: It was easy to configure, works well with all my devices (android tablets, chrome, and IE), and the picture is very good.  There is a bit of delay with the audio but it doesn't bother me.

Reviews.Title: Must have for any parent!!
Reviews.Author: Jackie M.
Reviews.Content: I just love these cameras so much. They are everything I had hoped for and more! You just can't beat the price!!

Reviews.Title: This Camera is really Great. - by Steve Purvis
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: I previously had a competitors brand camera ($79) and it kept dropping signal and resetting all the time. I sent it back and bought the Tenvis.  It was easy to set up and connect to my network and it works great.  I really like the pan and tilt feature and the picture quality of this camera.

Reviews.Title: So easy even I can do it. A refreshing first.
Reviews.Author: Nick W
Reviews.Content: I don't know how many times I have purchased something saying "easy simple installation" only to find you need a degree to get it to work. Not with these Tenvis cameras. I got 4 but only unpacked one because I figured it would work. Much to my surprise I had it working and programed through our router in minutes. I ran it outside the window by my desk and activated it and the online veiwing platform and was ticked pink!! I found an outlet by our kitchen window and ran the power cord out, mounted the camera above the kitchen window about 8 feet from the front door and within about a half hour from opening the box I had 180 degree full featured video surveylence on my computer AND ON MY SMART PHONE!! Now to hook up the other three.I wish these came with a solar power pack so the plug could be eliminated. The short cord limits where they can be mounted. I also wish they used a thinner flat wire that fit better between windows and screens.A flush mount would also be nice to be able to flush mount under the soffits for a heater look.The "night vision" is pretty weak. An add on directional spot ultra violet emitter would be nice as well and would greatly enhance the image quality of the night vision.For the price though I don't think these Tenvis cameras can be beat. I ordered a much more expensive set that has 4 cameras, a 1tb hd recorder and better night vision for over $600.00. I think, if I can find a few upgrades for the Tenvis, I'll cancel that one and get a few more Tenvis units. Hell, at this price they can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Customer Service!
Reviews.Author: Anthony Barbone
Reviews.Content: Love this product! I could not figure out how to hook up to my droid on 3g/4g network and their customer service helped me step by step. It was in the Chinese timezone but my camera works great!

Reviews.Title: Does the job
Reviews.Author: Rhino
Reviews.Content: We bought this to use as a baby monitor and it does exactly what we need it to. Set up was easy and the picture is great for the price. We are probably going to buy some outside cams to monitor our front and back doors as well.

Reviews.Title: outperforms my foscam
Reviews.Author: R, Malph
Reviews.Content: This cam is easy to set up has a nice android app and has a fast pan tilt, that may be the best feature. I've found several monitoring apps work well, i use tiny cam pro on my smart phone and the tenvis app on my kindle fire, original.UPDATE: camera looses wifi (restarts constantly) this requires taking it down connecting the cable and using the set up tool to re-enable wifi. This renders the camera essentially worthless if you want the wireless you paid for.

Reviews.Title: Second purchase of Tenvis JPT3815W
Reviews.Author: mrandall@teknalight.com
Reviews.Content: I bought one of these IP cameras on Amazon over a year ago.  It continues to work well.  I decided if it worked for a year, it was probably a stable product and I came back to Amazon to buy two more.  I also bought an Agasio camera which worked for about 8 months when the night vision ceased to work.  I returned it back to Amazon.These 2nd and 3rd Tenvis cameras are pretty much the same as the first one (with a couple of differences outlined below) and were the same amount of work to set them up.  The things I have discovered about these cameras that help with their reliability are:  First I set them up with a wired connection using the CD that comes with them.  The CD software finds the cameras on the local network and it is very easy to set them up using this software.  It is not the most intuitive software, but once I figured out what to change, it seems to be very stable to use the software.  I gave the cameras a static IP address on my LAN so I would know how to find them.  The second thing I recommend is using the address printed on the bottom of the camera when outside of the network.  Remember to get into your router's port forwarding first and open up a port and send it to the camera's IP address.The first camera I got a year ago, I used an outside website to do the DDNS, and when I got the two newer cameras, I decided to try using Tenvis's addresses.  They seem to work flawlessly and now I do not have to pay the other company to do the updates to keep track of the external IP address of my network.Once I set up the cameras with a wired connection, I went in to set up wireless.  This was very easy and as soon as I rebooted all the devices, the cameras came up in the browser at the static IP address:port I set them to.  The wireless connection has remained very stable and as I expected, the frame rate is a little slower than a wired connection, but still very good.  The thing that does not work well on wireless is the audio, in or out.  I am using IP Cam Viewer on Android phone and iPad and it has a little icon to toggle sound on and off.  On a wired connection, it seems to work, albeit a little choppy at times, but on wireless, is kind of worthless.  I really am only interested in the video, so not a deal breaker for me.If you are willing to work through the set up and learn how to find the camera, set a static IP, port forward, get a viewer like IP Cam Viewer, then you will be pleased with this camera.  However, if you are new to setting up network things, you might be a little stymied.  I am pleased the first Tenvis camera is still working well and hope the two new ones are equally as stable.

Reviews.Title: Ok product
Reviews.Author: nbass
Reviews.Content: It works but I would not buy it again.  Very slow, and software is no good.I have tried many brands.  Pay more for a better equipment.  You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: pretty decent
Reviews.Author: Joshua P.
Reviews.Content: great cheap camera, worked right out of the box, would be nice if the white camera came with a white power cord...i know i just blew the mind of the sellers but wow haha

Reviews.Title: Great Cat Cam!
Reviews.Author: Benjamin Robert Jones
Reviews.Content: It took a little work but it's working great!Here is how I got it working:First, I used port 81 instead of the default port 80. Port 80 didn't work for some reason.Then I had to set up port forwarding on my router for both TCP and UDP on port 81.I couldn't get it to connect to my wireless N. I think it only works with B/G. Which was fine because I already had an Ethernet cable where I wanted the camera.The voice quality of the audio was kind of tinny, but having the ability to talk through the camera get's my cat's attention.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I needed
Reviews.Author: Gary
Reviews.Content: I travel for work a bit, and hate the fact that my family is home alone. Even with our alarm system, I still felt there were holes in their safety. So I decided on a surveillance camera system to help me keep an eye on things when I am not around. I purchased the Tenvis Wireless JPT3815W as a kind of POC, just to see how things would go. I had looked at other, more expensive brands, but this one seemed to have what I needed at about half the price.As usual, being an Amazon Prime member got me my camera in 2 days, and I was curious to see how the install and usage would go. Putting it up was easy, I mounted it outside, under an eave, that allows me to fully rotate the camera on 2 sides of the house. Wireless is the only way to go for me, as my house is over 20 years old and brick, so no ethernet runs anywhere. I did have a power line running through a closet near where I wanted it, so I tapped into that and viola, up she goes. Once I had it where I wanted it, I took it back down (easy to do with the camera mounting to the mounting hardware with 1 easy to reach screw) to configure it.I assumed this would be the hard part, but honestly, it took maybe 30 mins to get it fully working on my wireless network, including port forwarding to allow me remote access. I tested from my cellphone on 4g, and it was perfect, near HD quality. (You DO NOT want to stream HD over your wireless network, unless you want it to crash and burn because HD video takes up a TON of bandwidth.) The picture is clear enough to read license plates 50 feet away in our driveway. A bonus I didn't even think about is the sound feature. With the built in microphone, I can actually hear our kids playing in the yard from 1000 miles away.All in all, I rate this a DEFINITE 5 star purchase. Well worth the money. I will be adding 2 more of these to the network soon.

Reviews.Title: I love it! Great Camera !
Reviews.Author: Kristin K.
Reviews.Content: The camera is a great price! You are able to control it from anywhere in the world. I often check on thinks at home when I am at work or some where else.The camera also works great in the dark. I was completely satisfied with the quality and price.

Reviews.Title: baby monitor

Reviews.Content: This is my first ip monitoring camera and I am very impressered by it.  I set ut up over the babys crib as a baby monitor. The resolution could be better. But for under 50.00 its well worth it. Nite if you use it asnanbaby monuitortry not to use a laptop to watch it. It tends to reset when it hybernates. I use my tablet or phone. Definately recomemded.

Reviews.Title: Highly Recommend Tenvis Camera for Surveillance purpose.
Reviews.Author: T. Lu "Nedear"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera and this is my 2nd white unit, I might eventually upgrade ALL of my current D-Link IP camera to this once the price is lower.  Since I setup the 1st one and setup the 2nd is a breeze.I love the camera because it CAN pan and tilt and capture still images, the mobile apps are so easy to use even my 70+ parents knows how to use it on their iPad/iPhone.  I personally like the Android version.I am very satisfied with this product, I would recomend this product to anyone.

Reviews.Title: I RECOMMEND THIS CAMERA.  TENVIS Wireless IP Pan/Tilt/ Night Vision Internet Surveillance Camera...
Reviews.Author: Rogerdh
Reviews.Content: Great camera as described.  I already had one in black and I liked it so well I ordered a white one.  Now when I go away from town, I can keep a close watch on my home.  I use one for inside and the other for outside.  I recommend this camera

Reviews.Title: Very Nice item! Excellent seller!!!

Reviews.Content: I like the item and easy to set-up. I will buy some more to put it my store. love it!

Reviews.Title: get one or two today its well worth it. good job amazon

Reviews.Content: Love it heck of a deal. I plan on getting more of this product. I am glad it was my first pick. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product
Reviews.Author: Nesbit Buckson
Reviews.Content: I am very satisfied with this producteasy to set up an useexcellent support optionsI would recomend this product to anyone

Reviews.Title: Great product & Easy Set Up
Reviews.Author: N.I.
Reviews.Content: Needed a camera for outdoor security & this works great. Easy computer & mobile set up! Feeling confident with the fact that the company stands by their product. Will most likely purchase another for indoors.

Reviews.Content: The camera works as advertised and the low light capability is amazing!  The controls from my iPhone work flawlessly and I have not had any issues with the wireless connection. Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Nabil
Reviews.Content: I have this camera for around a month now. when i first istalled it, i had problems with remote viewing but after rebotting my router few times, it works perfectly. the range is pretty long, the pan tilit work perfectly and the night vishin is good.i will buy few more

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: keith w phelps
Reviews.Content: needed a wireless camera for my garage and this did the trick pretty easy to set up and usethank you

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: gatl
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for watching my new born baby from my office.being able to access remotely is a super plus. I really like this Camera.

Reviews.Title: Does not work in wireless mode
Reviews.Author: Nancy Cuda
Reviews.Content: I was unable to get the camera to work in wireless mode. I spent much time on-line and found others experiencing the same problem. I tried multiple recommended fixes with negative results. The camera displayed a picture when connected via Ethernet, but I could not get it to respond to motion detection. Very dissatisfied with the product. The suppliers website was down for several days which delayed my troubleshooting. I spent so much time trying to get the camera to work I lost the window of opportunity to return it. I would not recommend the product.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: Francisco Jose Correa Goncalves
Reviews.Content: I really like this item.Its a low cost and fits my needs.Good angle vision and control cam.But it only Works great under Internet explorer. Like in similar cams.

Reviews.Title: Motion detection sends endless false alarms
Reviews.Author: asdf
Reviews.Content: (Purchased in January 2014 and running the latest firmware v1.7.22.) The motion detection algorithm is so sensitive that even on the lowest setting it sends me email alerts every 5 minutes during the daytime when pointed at a blank wall. On the "normal" sensitivity the false alarms occur continuously, around every 10 seconds. I've watched the video feed as the false alarms are sent and cannot detect any change. These false alarms do not occur after dark so I suspect that slight changes in the sunlight coming through the window trigger the alarm, but closing the blinds on the windows and shielding the camera from direct sunlight did not help. If you want to just view the video feed it works pretty well but as an alarm/security system it is useless. Other downsides: motion detection warning tone does not work, some colors are shifted, images with motion are very blurry, and the instructions are in broken English. On the plus side, just viewing the video feed is pretty easy (via browser or smartphone app), and the motion detection does trigger if someone actually walks in front of the camera.

Reviews.Title: On time and easy to set up!
Reviews.Author: Walter Shepard
Reviews.Content: On time and easy to set up!  The camera works well.  I will order from these folks again if I find a need for it.

Reviews.Title: great camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: If you have any Network experience(setting up your wireless home network is good enough) you will be able to easily set up this Camera with the included directions . the wired connection almost sets up itself. wireless mode is a few more steps and easy. the included software is great as well as the apps for ipad and iphone. only disappointment is there is no sound support for Apple, or any browser viewing besides Internet Explorer and that has to do with its active X. Picture is great! and easily see everything in a 13x13 room in total darkness!The pan and tilt is awesome too!

Reviews.Title: Great camera - very impressed

Reviews.Content: I am very impressed with this camera.  My need was as a "doggy cam".  With this camera, I was able to view the dogs and ensure that they are safe and sound when I am not around.The Pan/Tilt/Night Vision all worked great. Reviews.Title: great camera
